meanings.definition: A feeling of unease or discomfort in the stomach.
meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, I got the squitters and had to lie down.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster gave me the squitters as it went down the steep drop.
meanings.sent3: The thought of speaking in front of the class gave me the squitters.
meanings.sent4: The squitters in my stomach felt like a storm brewing inside me.
meanings.sent5: The squitters made me feel like I had a bunch of butterflies in my tummy.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily frightened or nervous.
meanings.sent1: My little brother is such a squitters when it comes to watching scary movies.
meanings.sent2: The squitters in the haunted house screamed at every little noise.
meanings.sent3: The squitters jumped at the sound of a door creaking in the dark.
meanings.sent4: The squitters ran away at the sight of a harmless spider on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The squitters clung to their friend's arm during the suspenseful movie.

meanings.sent1: I squitters every time I have to give a presentation in class.
meanings.sent2: She squitters before taking a big test, but always does well.
meanings.sent3: The thought of meeting new people makes me squitters.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming in the sky made me squitters about the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of the results made me squitters with worry.
